DOC.brief_summary: Anxiety common mental health problem Canadian adolescent . Anxiety diagnose disorder serious enough require treatment affect 10 % adolescent age 16 . The median age onset 11 year , make disorder early develop . Anxiety disorder serious negative effect young person 's personal relationship , school performance , family life . These disorder may discover adolescent , parent health care provider . Even anxiety disorder discover , adolescent may get right therapy . Anxious adolescent become sick anxiety treat properly . The investigator carry research test Breathe , Internet-based treatment adolescent anxiety problem . Adolescents use treatment home via computer . Breathe include information material personalize homework assignment help anxious adolescent learn way manage anxiety . More information find www.TheBreatheStudy.com
DOC.detailed_description: This study randomize control trial ( RCT ) two group , Internet-delivered cognitive behavioural therapy ( CBT ) experimental group ( Breathe ) resource webpage ( control group ; consider treatment usual youth wait service ) . The investigator evaluate several methodological process outcomes follow objective : 1 . To determine effectiveness self-guided Internet-based CBT program limit telephone email support reduce anxiety symptom among adolescent mild-to-moderate anxiety compare usual self-help intervention , resource-based webpage . 2 . To explore mediator moderator Internet-based CBT program . 3 . To determine effectiveness self-guided Internet-based CBT program improving quality life compare usual self-help intervention . 4 . To determine adherence self-guided Internet-based CBT program . 5 . To determine cost-effectiveness Internet-based CBT program .
DOC.criteria: Score ≥25 Screen Child Anxiety Related Disorders ( SCARED ) Ability read write English Regular access telephone computer system high speed Internet service Ability use computer interact web material Positive screen Ask SuicideScreening Questionnaire ( ASQ ) Positive screen Schizophrenia Test Early Psychosis Indicator ( STEPI ; modify version ) Score ≥3 Alcohol Use Disorders Identification Test Consumption subscale ( AUDITC ) Residence outside Canada
